From: charliehubbard76@... [mailto:charliehubbard76@...]

To: junit@egroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: newbie question: how to avoid rerunning fixture code on every test

--- In junit@egroups.com, "Stephen P Peterson"
<stephen.peterson@i...> wrote:
> What if the setup logic involves connecting to databases and
> running queries that tends to be a bit slow for doing on every
> single test?  Is an explanation available anywhere on the web
> telling how to get tests to run faster by executing slow
> initialization code only once before all the tests?

Stephen,

What you want to do is create a class that extends TestSetup. 
TestSetups allow you to do some initilization/de-initilization around
a test suite just as you described.

class MyTestSetup extends TestSetup {
  public MyTestSetup( Test t ) {
    super(t);
  }

  protected void setUp() {
    Connection = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:url");
  }

  protected void tearDown() {
  }
}

class MyTest extends TestCase {
  public MyTest( String name ) {
    super( name );
  }

  public void testOne() {
  }

  public static Test suite() {
     return new MyTestSetup( new TestSuite( MyTest.class ) );
  }

  public static void main( String args[] ) {
     TestRunner.run( suite() );
  }
}
